title: what has the Strictly star had done?
text:
Get the biggest celebs stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Catherine Tyldesley has been turning heads on Strictly Come Dancing ever since partnering up with Johannes Radebe for the hit BBC1 show.

And she's no stranger to a body transformation, having lost five stone and going from a size 22 to a 10 by ditching the unhealthy diet and getting lean in the gym.

Since finding fame on Coronation Street as Eva Price in 2011, Catherine's face has changed dramatically, too.

She now favours a soft chestnutty brunette for her long locks, rather than the blonde tone she used to sport.

And the 36-year-old mum of one now has fuller eyebrows to balance out her face.

Here, a surgeon from MYA Cosmetic Surgery gives their expert opinion on the work Catherine might have had done.

However, Catherine's rep has told Mirror Online the soap star categorically has not had any plastic surgery - and if she had, she would be open about it.

"Typically, women's breasts can fluctuate in size due to hormones, weight loss or weight gain. Catherine has lost a significant amount of weight over the years, going from a size 22 to a 10, which can often result in a loss of breast tissue," says the expert.

(Image: BPM)

(Image: Getty Images)

"In my professional opinion, there is an obvious increase to Catherine's breasts that suggest she may have undergone a breast enlargement procedure; the upper breast volume has increased quite significantly and they now sit much higher on the chest wall.

"It's particularly noticeable when you compare these photos to previous images where she appears to have a lack of breast tissue altogether following the weight loss.

"I also believe that Catherine may have undergone the non-surgical treatment of dermal fillers to her lips as she appears to have slightly fuller lips compared to previous images.

(Image: SOPA Images/LightRocket via Gett)

"The average cost of lip fillers in the UK can range depending on the provider and the amount of filler used, however, you can expect to pay anything from £200 to £1,000 per treatment."

Catherine's rep added: "She absolutely has not had hasn't had a breast enlargement or lip fillers."

*Strictly Come Dancing continues tonight at 6.40pm on BBC1
description: Catherine Tyldesley underwent a dramatic body transformation in her 20s after losing five stone
